chapter_title: 6. So, the student of war who is unversed in the art of
claims: The student of war who is unversed in the art of varying his plans will fail to make the best use of his men.
In the wise leader’s plans, considerations of advantage and of disadvantage will be blended together.
rules: If our expectation of advantage be tempered in this way, we may succeed in accomplishing the essential part of our schemes.
If, on the other hand, in the midst of difficulties we are always ready to seize an advantage, we may extricate ourselves from misfortune.
